content:
There are several ways the general public can support and contribute to the research efforts at UPenn School of Medicine, including:

1. Donating - Donations can support ongoing research projects and help fund new breakthroughs. The UPenn School of Medicine has a variety of giving opportunities, including annual giving, major gifts, planned giving, and more.

2. Participating in clinical trials - Clinical trials are an essential part of the research process, and volunteers are always needed to participate. By participating in a clinical trial, you can contribute to the development of new treatments and therapies.

3. Spreading awareness - Spreading the word about important research projects and breakthroughs can help raise awareness and generate support for the efforts of the UPenn School of Medicine.

4. Engaging with UPenn researchers - Researchers at UPenn are often willing to engage with the public and share their expertise. Attending events, lectures, and other opportunities to engage with researchers can help build support for their work.

5. Volunteering - There are a variety of volunteer opportunities at UPenn, including working in laboratories, assisting with clinical trials, and more. By volunteering your time and expertise, you can contribute to the research efforts in a meaningful way.
